intro: Vincetoxicum grandifolium, commonly known as greatleaf snakeroot, is a perennial flowering plant native to the eastern United States. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae and is characterized by its showy, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant has opposite, heart-shaped leaves that are typically large and glossy. It thrives in moist, shady environments and is often found in woodlands and along stream banks. Vincetoxicum grandifolium is also known for its latex-containing sap, which can be toxic to livestock and humans.
